Emma-0.2.1/cpu/avr/i2c.h

00001 #ifndef HALI2C
00002 #define HALI2C
00003 
00004 #include <avr/io.h>
00006 #define I2C_READ    1
00007 
00009 #define I2C_WRITE   0
00010 
00011 /*************************************************************************
00012  Initialization of the I2C bus interface. Need to be called only once
00013 *************************************************************************/
00014 void i2c_init(void);
00015 
00016 
00017 /*************************************************************************      
00018   Issues a start condition and sends address and transfer direction.
00019   return 0 = device accessible, 1= failed to access device
00020 *************************************************************************/
00021 unsigned char i2c_start(unsigned char address);
00022 
00023 
00024 /*************************************************************************
00025  Issues a start condition and sends address and transfer direction.
00026  If device is busy, use ack polling to wait until device is ready
00027  
00028  Input:   address and transfer direction of I2C device
00029 *************************************************************************/
00030 int i2c_start_wait(unsigned char address);
00031 
00032 
00033 /*************************************************************************
00034  Issues a repeated start condition and sends address and transfer direction 
00035 
00036  Input:   address and transfer direction of I2C device
00037  
00038  Return:  0 device accessible
00039           1 failed to access device
00040 *************************************************************************/
00041 unsigned char i2c_rep_start(unsigned char address);
00042 
00043 
00044 /*************************************************************************
00045  Terminates the data transfer and releases the I2C bus
00046 *************************************************************************/
00047 void i2c_stop(void);
00048 
00049 
00050 /*************************************************************************
00051   Send one byte to I2C device
00052   
00053   Input:    byte to be transfered
00054   Return:   0 write successful 
00055             1 write failed
00056 *************************************************************************/
00057 unsigned char i2c_write( unsigned char data );
00058 
00059 
00060 /*************************************************************************
00061  Read one byte from the I2C device, request more data from device 
00062  
00063  Return:  byte read from I2C device
00064 *************************************************************************/
00065 unsigned char i2c_readAck(void);
00066 
00067 
00068 /*************************************************************************
00069  Read one byte from the I2C device, read is followed by a stop condition 
00070  
00071  Return:  byte read from I2C device
00072 *************************************************************************/
00073 unsigned char i2c_readNak(void);
00074 #endif
